<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 74, 128, 91]]<|/det|>
Data

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 105, 274, 122]]<|/det|>
acceleration of free fall \(g=9.81 \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{-2}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 136, 308, 154]]<|/det|>
speed of light in free space \(c=3.00 \times 10^{8} \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{-1}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 170, 239, 186]]<|/det|>
elementary charge \(e=1.60 \times 10^{-19} \mathrm{C}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 200, 631, 218]]<|/det|>
unified atomic mass unit \(1 \mathrm{u}=1.66 \times 10^{-27} \mathrm{~kg}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 231, 631, 251]]<|/det|>
rest mass of proton \(m_{\mathrm{p}}=1.67 \times 10^{-27} \mathrm{~kg}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 261, 631, 280]]<|/det|>
rest mass of electron \(m_{\mathrm{e}}=9.11 \times 10^{-31} \mathrm{~kg}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 292, 650, 312]]<|/det|>
Avogadro constant \(N_{\mathrm{A}}=6.02 \times 10^{23} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 324, 631, 342]]<|/det|>
molar gas constant \(R=8.31 \mathrm{~J} \mathrm{~K}^{-1} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 353, 650, 372]]<|/det|>
Boltzmann constant \(k=1.38 \times 10^{-23} \mathrm{~J} \mathrm{~K}^{-1}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 384, 689, 403]]<|/det|>
gravitational constant \(G=6.67 \times 10^{-11} \mathrm{Nm}^{2} \mathrm{~kg}^{-2}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 415, 656, 434]]<|/det|>
permittivity of free space \(\frac{\epsilon_{0}}{1}=\quad 8.85 \times 10^{-12} \mathrm{~Fm}^{-1}\)

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[408, 435, 653, 466]]<|/det|>
\[
\frac{1}{4 \pi \epsilon_{0}}=8.99 \times 10^{9} \mathrm{~mF}^{-1}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 478, 220, 495]]<|/det|>
Planck constant \(h=6.63 \times 10^{-34} \mathrm{~J} \mathrm{~s}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 509, 314, 526]]<|/det|>
Stefan-Boltzmann constant \(\sigma=5.67 \times 10^{-8} \mathrm{~W} \mathrm{~m}^{-2} \mathrm{~K}^{-4}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 567, 173, 583]]<|/det|>
Formulae

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 599, 324, 618]]<|/det|>
uniformly accelerated motion \(s=\frac{u t+\frac{1}{2} a t^{2}}{u^{2}+2 a s}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 649, 256, 667]]<|/det|>
hydrostatic pressure \(\Delta p=\rho g \Delta h\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 681, 157, 698]]<|/det|>
upthrust \(F=\rho g V\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 719, 344, 748]]<|/det|>
Doppler effect for sound waves \(f_{0}=\frac{f_{s} v}{v \pm v_{s}}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 763, 611, 780]]<|/det|>
electric current \(I=\text { Anvq }\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 792, 631, 811]]<|/det|>
resistors in series \(R=R_{1}+R_{2}+\ldots\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 823, 645, 857]]<|/det|>
resistors in parallel \(\frac{1}{R}=\frac{1}{R_{1}}+\frac{1}{R_{2}}+\ldots\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 325, 91]]<|/det|>
1 (a) Define acceleration.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 166, 918, 183]]<|/det|>
(b) In an experiment, two objects \(A\) and \(B\) are released from the side of a building, as shown in Fig. 1.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[215, 209, 783, 486]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[408, 503, 590, 521]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 534, 796, 551]]<|/det|>
Object \(A\) is released from rest at a height of 14 m above the horizontal ground. Object B is released with an initial upwards vertical velocity \(u\) at a height of 3.6 m above the

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 567, 225, 583]]<|/det|>
ground. Both objects take the same time to reach the ground and they do not collide with each other.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 595, 380, 612]]<|/det|>
Air resistance is negligible.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 626, 664, 644]]<|/det|>
(i) Calculate the time taken for object A to reach the ground.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[527, 731, 592, 750]]<|/det|>
time \(=\) s [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[152, 763, 525, 782]]<|/det|>
(ii) Use your answer in (b)(i) to calculate \(u\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[552, 903, 590, 921]]<|/det|>
\(u=\) \(\mathrm{ms}^{-1}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 74, 918, 91]]<|/det|>
(c) In a second experiment, object \(B\) is released from the same height and given the same initial speed as in (b) but at a release angle \(\theta\) to the vertical, as shown in Fig. 1.2.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[410, 117, 590, 280]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 295, 537, 313]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[159, 326, 918, 344]]<|/det|>
(i) State and explain whether the time taken for object \(B\) to reach the ground is less than, the same as or greater than the time in (b)(i).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[152, 464, 918, 483]]<|/det|>
(ii) By considering energy, state and explain the effect of the change in release angle on the speed at which B reaches the ground.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 197, 918, 215]]<|/det|>
